 Pointer to the hgeSprite which is actually rendered.

Detailed Description

Basic Sprite rendering class.

This class serves as a wrapper for the hgeSprite class.

See also:
Renderable

Definition at line 77 of file SimpleRenderable.cpp.

void SimpleRenderable::getTextureCoords ( float *  u,
float *  v,
float *  width,
float *  height 
)

Get the texture coordinates used by the hgeSprite.

Parameters:
u The pointer to store the u (left) coordinate in.
v The pointer to store the v (top) coordinate in.
width The pointer to store the width of the texture region used.
height The pointer to store the height of the texture region used.
Remarks:
All of these values are in image space which regardless to texture dimensions maps from (0, 0) (top left) to (1, 1) (bottom right), values greater than 1 or less than 0 indicate texture wrapping.

Definition at line 123 of file SimpleRenderable.cpp.

void SimpleRenderable::render ( SceneNode *const   node,
const hgeVector &  screenPosition,
Camera *const   cam 
) [virtual]

Core render method.

The other render methods call this method once it has been determined that the object should be rendered. This is the Template method.

Parameters:
node The node whose position, rotation, and scale are going to be used to render the object.
screenPosition The position to render the object at transformed into screen space.

Implements Renderable.

Definition at line 110 of file SimpleRenderable.cpp.

void SimpleRenderable::setSprite ( const std::string &  spriteName  ) 

Set the sprite to be used, overrides other settings as needed.

Parameters:
spriteName The name of the sprite to be used.
Remarks:
This method uses the hgeResourceManager which means spriteName must be defined in a loaded resource script before it can be used.

Definition at line 33 of file SimpleRenderable.cpp.

void SimpleRenderable::setTexture ( const int &  handle,
const float &  u,
const float &  v,
const float &  width,
const float &  height 
)

Set the texture to be applied to the sprite.

Parameters:
handle This is the HGE handle to the texture to be used.
u UV left coordinate to use.
v UV top coordinate to use.
width Width of the texture, if this is greater than the actual texture width the texture will be wrapped.
height Height of the texture, if this is greater than the actual texture height the texture will be wrapped.
Remarks:
Right now the only reason this exists is to allow RenderTextures to apply there textures to SimpleRenderables.
See also:
RenderTexture::getTexture()

Definition at line 65 of file SimpleRenderable.cpp.

void SimpleRenderable::setTexture ( const std::string &  texName  ) 

Set the texture to be applied to the sprite.

Parameters:
texName The name of the texture to be used.
Remarks:
This method uses the hgeResourceManager which means texName must be defined in a loaded resource script before it can be used.

Definition at line 46 of file SimpleRenderable.cpp.

void SimpleRenderable::setTextureCoords ( const float &  u,
const float &  v,
const float &  width,
const float &  height,
const bool &  adjustSize = true 
)

Set the Texture coords used by the hgeSprite.

Parameters:
u The left coordinate origin of the texture region to use.
v The top coordinate origin of the texture region to use.
width The width of the texture region to use.
height The height of the texture region to use.
Remarks:
All of these values are in image space which regardless to texture dimensions maps from (0, 0) (top left) to (1, 1) (bottom right), values greater than 1 or less than 0 indicate texture wrapping.
